posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Alas, you are not going to get that, not even close Theofilus.

It's simple math, let's make together the skeleton of the build to see what is like.

You will need 6 pre-epic feats as pre-requisites for Weapon Master, then another 3 for Dev. Critical (Power attack, Cleave, Great Cleave), 1 more for the Scythe and 2 more for the must-have Bard feats (Curse Song, Still Spell), finally you will need at least Blind Fight, Heavy Armour and Improved Critical, and i am not going to say anything at all for the lack of  KD/ IKD/ Expertise e.t.c. That makes 15 feats and you are not going to get anymore than the half of them even if you go Human, so you need to give all of your epic feats as well for those and still leave things out. since we haven't taken any of the epic feats like Epic Weapon Focus, Armour Skin, Epic Prowess, Overwhelming Critical, Terrifying Rage...

Lets say we manage to take the most important from these above and leave things out like (Power attack, Cleave, Great Cleave, Overwhelming Critical), we go for a straight killer at least. Since not even in our dreams can afford to get any Great Strength feats, even if you min/max your attributes, your AB is going to be something like 42 max. And even then you are going to forfeit many feats from your list.

{STR 16 (26)  DEX 13  CON 08  INT 13  WIS 08  CHA 16}

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: On the other hand, if you want an Intimidating Scyther, the most realistic build would be something like (Barbarian 16/ Bard 2/ WM 22) with Bard being there for full tumble, umd and max spellcraft for saves. That would be a real powerhouse though and could even start as a Half-Orc.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: As for TR in PvP: Only characters with less than the Barbarian's hit die will panic. Opponents with with the same and up to twice the barbarian's hit dice will not flee but will only receive a -2 penalty to attack and saving throw rolls.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Exactly, and that also means that a TR Barbarian/ Bard/ RDD has also the best possible DC for Devastating Critical by far, (a potencial of 57 i believe, after TR and Curse Song kick-in). Hmm, maybe Cleric/ Bard/ RDD's can top that with Battletide/ Prayer/ Curse Song by one, oh well...
